001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005
006/**
007 * A simple linear combination of the form:
008 * <pre>
009 *   f(x) = Σ w_i * x_i
010 * </pre>
011 * where the weights are trainable parameters.
012 * <p>
013 * This class supports forward estimation of the scalar output as well as
014 * calculation of parameter parameterGradients required for gradient-based training.
015 *
016 * @see AffineTransformation
017 */
018@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
019public class LinearCombination<N extends Number> implements TrainableScalarFunction<N> {
020
021    private final N[] parameters;
022    private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
023
024    /**
025     * Creates a new {@code LinearCombination} with the specified number of input dimensions.
026     * <p>
027     * The underlying parameter vector will have length {@code dimensions} representing the weights.
028     *
029     * @param dimensions number of input features
030     * @return a new {@code LinearCombination} instance with zero-initialized parameters
031     */
032    public static <N extends Number> LinearCombination<N> create(int dimensions, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
033        return new LinearCombination<>(typeSupport.createArray(dimensions), typeSupport);
034    }
035
036    /**
037     * Constructs a {@code LinearCombination} with the given parameter vector.
038     *
039     * @param parameters parameter vector (weights)
040     */
041    public LinearCombination(N[] parameters, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
042        this.parameters = parameters;
043        this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
044    }
045
046    @Override
047    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getCurrentNumberType() {
048        return typeSupport;
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * Estimates the scalar output of this linear model for the given input vector.
053     * <p>
054     * The computation is:
055     * <pre>
056     *   output = Σ (inputs[i] * weights[i])
057     * </pre>
058     *
059     * @param inputs the input feature vector
060     * @return the scalar output value
061     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code inputs.length != arity()}
062     */
063    @Override
064    public N estimateScalar(N[] inputs) {
065        if (inputs.length != parameters.length) {
066            throw new IllegalArgumentException();
067        }
068        N sum = typeSupport.zero();
069        for (int d = 1; d <= parameters.length; d++) {
070            sum = typeSupport.add(sum, typeSupport.multiply(inputs[d - 1], getWeight(d)));
071        }
072        return sum;
073    }
074
075    /**
076     * Calculates the parameterGradients of the output with respect to all parameters (weights)
077     * for the given input vector.
078     * <p>
079     * The gradient vector has length {@code arity()}, where:
080     * <ul>
081     *   <li>Indices 0..arity correspond to the input values, i.e. ∂f/∂w_i = input[i-1].</li>
082     * </ul>
083     *
084     * @param inputs the input feature vector
085     * @return the gradient vector (weight parameterGradients)
086     */
087    @Override
088    public N[] calculateParameterGradients(N[] inputs) {
089        return inputs;
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * {@inheritDoc}
094     */
095    @Override
096    public int getParameterCount() {
097        return parameters.length;
098    }
099
100    /**
101     * Returns the full parameter vector of this model.
102     *
103     * @return the parameter array
104     */
105    @Override
106    public N[] getParameters() {
107        return parameters;
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * {@inheritDoc}
112     */
113    @Override
114    public N getParameter(int p) {
115        return parameters[p];
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * {@inheritDoc}
120     */
121    @Override
122    public void setParameters(N[] values) {
123        System.arraycopy(values, 0, parameters, 0, parameters.length);
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * {@inheritDoc}
128     */
129    @Override
130    public void setParameter(int p, N value) {
131        parameters[p] = value;
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Returns the number of input features this model accepts,
136     * equal to the number of weights (parameters.length).
137     *
138     * @return the arity (number of input dimensions)
139     */
140    @Override
141    public int arity() {
142        return parameters.length;
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * Checks if a given dimension index is valid.
147     *
148     * @param d dimension index, starting from 1
149     * @return the same index if valid
150     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code d} is out of range
151     */
152    protected final int validDimension(int d) {
153        if (d < 1 || d > parameters.length) {
154            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid dimension!");
155        }
156        return d;
157    }
158
159    /**
160     * Returns a copy of the weights (all parameters except the bias).
161     *
162     * @return the weight vector
163     */
164    public N[] getWeights() {
165        return parameters;
166    }
167
168    /**
169     * Replaces all weights with the given vector.
170     *
171     * @param weights the new weight vector
172     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the number of weights does not match {@link #arity()}
173     */
174    public void setWeights(N[] weights) {
175        if (weights.length != parameters.length) {
176            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid number of weights!");
177        }
178        System.arraycopy(weights, 0, parameters, 0, parameters.length);
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Returns the weight for a given dimension (1-based).
183     *
184     * @param d dimension index, starting from 1
185     * @return the weight value
186     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code d} is out of range
187     */
188    public N getWeight(int d) {
189        return parameters[validDimension(d) - 1];
190    }
191
192    /**
193     * Sets the weight for a given dimension (1-based).
194     *
195     * @param d      dimension index, starting from 1
196     * @param weight the new weight value
197     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code d} is out of range
198     */
199    public void setWeight(int d, N weight) {
200        parameters[validDimension(d) - 1] = weight;
201    }
202
203    /**
204     * Adjusts the weight for a given dimension (1-based) by adding {@code delta}.
205     *
206     * @param d     dimension index, starting from 1
207     * @param delta the adjustment value
208     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code d} is out of range
209     */
210    public void adjustWeight(int d, N delta) {
211        parameters[d - 1] = typeSupport.add(parameters[validDimension(d) - 1], delta);
212    }
213
214}
